summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary interview conducted by DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) agents with a Federal Bureau of Prisons lieutenant on September 1, 2021, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The interview is part of an OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein and surrounding circumstances, focusing on follow-up questions regarding the movement of Epstein's cellmate, Efrain Reyes, on August 9, 2019. This document is a transcript of an interview conducted by Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General agents with a correctional officer (referred to as MR. [REDACTED]) regarding events at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 9, 2019. The interview focuses on the transfer of inmate Efrain Reyes (Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate) and the failure to assign Epstein a new cellmate, as well as a separate incident involving inmate Fernandez. The questioning centers on procedural failures and accountability.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: High-profile inmate in the SHU. The interview investigates why he was not assigned a new cellmate after Reyes was transferred.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Inmate who was transferred from the MCC SHU on August 9, 2019, leaving Jeffrey Epstein without a cellmate. His transfer is a central point of the interview.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: The witness being interviewed, a lieutenant at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, who is providing information about inmate movements and procedures.

persons.name: Fernandez
persons.context: Inmate involved in a separate incident in the SHU visiting room on August 9, 2019, where he attempted to grab an item from a visitor.

persons.name: MR. [REDACTED]
persons.context: The interviewee, a correctional officer working in the SHU on August 9, 2019. He is questioned about his actions and knowledge regarding the transfer of Reyes and the failure to assign Epstein a new cellmate.

persons.name: Officer [REDACTED]
persons.context: Officer who allegedly escorted Reyes and Epstein. The interviewee claims to have told this officer that Epstein needed a new cellmate.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: Operations lieutenant contacted regarding the Fernandez incident. The interviewee sent an email to this lieutenant.

persons.name: Senior Special Agent [REDACTED]
persons.context: Agent identified at the end of the transcript as turning off the recorder.

connections.description: Reyes was Epstein's cellmate in the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The lieutenant, as a BOP employee, had custodial and supervisory responsibilities regarding inmate Reyes.
The lieutenant, as a BOP employee, had custodial and supervisory responsibilities regarding inmate Epstein.
The officer was responsible for escorting Reyes from the SHU for his transfer on August 9, 2019.
The officer was the OIC in the SHU where Epstein was housed and spoke to Epstein about getting a new cellmate.
The interviewee claims to have told this officer that Epstein needed a new cellmate after Reyes left.
The officer sent an email to the operations lieutenant regarding the Fernandez incident.

events.title: OIG Interview with BOP Lieutenant
events.description: DOJ OIG agents conduct a voluntary, sworn interview with a BOP lieutenant at the Metropolitan Correctional Center regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Efrain Reyes Pre-removed from MCC
events.description: Inmate Efrain Reyes, Epstein's cellmate, was logged as 'pre-removed' at 8:35 AM from the Metropolitan Correctional Center, indicating he left the building and was likely not returning.

events.title: Lieutenant's Previous Interview on Epstein Matter
events.description: The lieutenant was previously interviewed regarding the Epstein matter on this date.

events.title: Lieutenant's Previous Interview with OIG Agents
events.description: The lieutenant was interviewed again by the same OIG agents on this date prior to the September 1 interview.

events.title: Transfer of Efrain Reyes
events.description: Inmate Efrain Reyes is transferred from the MCC SHU to another facility (GEO). He is listed as 'pre-remove' and 'WAB' (With All Belongings), indicating he was not expected to return.

events.title: Failure to Assign Epstein New Cellmate
events.description: After Reyes is transferred, Jeffrey Epstein is left without a cellmate. Despite the officer telling Epstein he would get a new 'bunkie' and allegedly notifying other staff, no new cellmate is assigned during the shift.

events.title: Fernandez Visiting Room Incident
events.description: Inmate Fernandez attempts to grab an unknown item from a visitor in the SHU visiting room. He is removed from the visiting room, a visual search is conducted, and he is eventually moved to an R&D dry cell.

events.title: Transfer Order for Reyes
events.description: Emails are sent scheduling the transfer of Efrain Reyes for August 9, 2019, including instructions for medication.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General, New York Field Office
28632 Roadside Drive, Suite 285, Agoura Hills, CA 91301 (Resolute Documentation Services)
Nine South visiting room (SHU visiting room)
keyFacts: The interview is part of an official DOJ OIG investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein and related circumstances, focusing on job performance and security failures.

The witness, a BOP lieutenant, confirms that inmate Efrain Reyes (Epstein's cellmate) was 'pre-removed' from the MCC at 8:35 AM on August 9, 2019, a procedure meaning he left the building and was likely not returning.
The interview clarifies that 'pre-remove' and 'WAB' (with all belongings) are essentially the same procedure for moving an inmate out of the facility.
The document reveals the OIG's investigative focus on inmate movement logs and procedures at the MCC around the time of Epstein's death.
The interview investigates a critical procedural failure: why Jeffrey Epstein was not assigned a new cellmate after his cellmate, Efrain Reyes, was transferred on August 9, 2019.

The officer (MR. [REDACTED]) admits he knew Reyes was listed as 'WAB' (With All Belongings), which typically means an inmate is leaving, but claims there was still a possibility Reyes could return within hours.
The officer claims he notified other officers ([REDACTED] and [REDACTED]) that Epstein needed a new cellmate, but those officers, when interviewed, denied being told.

A separate incident involving inmate Fernandez on the same day reveals potential communication and procedural breakdowns in notifying control when an inmate is moved, paralleling issues in the Epstein/Reyes situation.
The document highlights a culture of assumed responsibility, where staff believed someone else would handle key tasks like notifying control or assigning a new cellmate, leading to failures.
